Consumer complaint narrative: subject complaint against bank of america for inadequate dispute resolution practices dear consumer financial protection bureau i am writing to formally complain about bank of americas handling of a disputed charge filed on xxxxyear the dispute involved a charge of 50000 by xxxx for goods and services that were not provided bank of america closed the investigation prematurely on xxxxyear despite providing a deadline of xxxxyear for me to submit additional information i believe this premature closure without adequate investigation and the opportunity to present further evidence violates consumer protection regulations and demonstrates negligence on xxxxyear bank of america requested that i submit more information to support my dispute providing me until xxxxyear to comply i promptly submitted relevant documentation including a receipt and consumer statement as requested however bank of america limited me to only five items on their submission platform thus restricting my ability to fully support my claim then on xxxxyear just one day after my submission bank of america closed the investigation with the explanation our research included the information you provided with your claim your account history the monthly account statements we sent you and if available information from the merchant such as a signed receipt or contract we made this decision the abrupt decision raises concerns about the thoroughness of bank of americas investigation especially given that the submitted evidence had not even been reviewed in full by the specified deadline in this context i believe bank of america may have failed to adhere to its obligations under the fair credit billing act fcba 15 usc 1666 which mandates that creditors conduct a reasonable investigation into disputed charges according to 12 cfr 102613 creditors are obligated to resolve disputes in good faith requiring reasonable procedures for investigating claims and soliciting additional information from consumers where necessary bank of americas closure of my dispute just one day after my submissionwithout allowing me to provide further evidence by the deadlinedemonstrates a lack of good faith and a failure to follow reasonable investigatory procedures furthermore bank of americas actions may contravene precedents established by the cfpb regarding thorough investigations of disputed charges in cases such as in re xxxx xxxx cfpb consent order xxxx the cfpb has underscored the importance of a creditors duty to engage in complete and fair investigations especially when additional documentation or consumer statements are provided in light of these points i request the consumer financial protection bureau to investigate bank of americas dispute resolution practices and determine whether their handling of my case aligns with fcba requirements and relevant consumer protection standards bank of america should have requested further information if the first submission was deemed unsatisfactory given that i had until xxxxyear to provide supporting evidence thank you for your attention to this matter i look forward to your assistance in ensuring that bank of america upholds its responsibilities to consumers under the law
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: on xxxx2019 i was made aware that my account was overdrawn due to an item that came through for 10000 the only problem is there was a positive balance still left in the account when the overdraft took place i called suntrust bank on xxxx2019 to get a better understanding as to why the overdraft fee was assessed to the account being that there was still a positive balance in the account when the overdraft was assessed to the account the operator whom i could barely understand stated that the account was overdrafted even when it had a positive balance to the best of my understanding is what she said and she couldnt explain to me why because it doesnt make sense to me that you can overdraft when you have a positive balance in your account so according to this operator its pretty much like the banks at their discretion can go back and find any low point during your transactions history and use that point at which to charge an overdraft to your account and hoping that it sticks so in other words banks are so desperate now to steal money out of consumers accounts that they overdraft you even though you have a positive balance in the account no matter how little the positive balance is its still a positive balance none the less ive taken screenshots of the withdrawals as they happened and it clearly shows that on xxxxxxxx of 2019 after the 10000 was taken out of the account there was still a positive balance of 500 in the account so again i ask why was the overdraft fee assessed theres absolutely no explanation for that other than just the bank wanted to overdraft the account i guess it was just my turn to be ripped off with that frivolous fee labeled as an overdraft fee i personally am so sick and tired of banks manipulating consumer bank accounts so that they can work it in their favor to charge overdraft fees and other frivolous fees to consumers accounts to make money it is so sad and so pathetic the state of our nation where every financial institution is looking for ways of increasing profit at the expense of consumers i remember reading stories about old men many years ago warning people about banks and i see now that it is an absolute fact that a consumer has no chance of making it financially when they depend on the banks because the banks job is not too make sure your bills are paid on time a bank s job is to make sure they increase their profits every year its called shareholder fiduciary im at the point now that i will no longer put my paycheck or more money in a bank account than i need in there to cover a bill i will only put in the bank the monthly service fee and what i need to pay a particular bill it will save me tons of money and stress long term over dealing with banks that are only looking to take the little i have and even worse theyll even manipulate a person s account to make it look legitimate

reasoning for the funds getting put back on my card were because i did not attach documentation which this brings me to this letter overall this experience of home depot installation has been one of consider this dispute and the time that it has taken and funds it has taken from me as well

Consumer complaint narrative: to whom it may concern at the cfpb i am submitting this complaint against american express national bank american express alleging violations of federal statutes related to an unlawful credit denial potential discriminatory practices and noncompliance with the truth in lending act tila equal credit opportunity act ecoa fair credit reporting act fcra and other consumer protection laws background on xxxxyear i applied for the american express platinum card providing all required personal and financial information american express denied my application based on information from my consumer report despite knowing that the information was false and unverifiable following this denial i submitted xxxx notarized affidavits on xxxxyear and xxxxyear asserting that the consumer report data used was inaccurate and demanding lawful justification verification of the method used and compliance with federal consumer protection laws along with these affidavits i submitted an invoice for 4900000 in damages despite this american express has not reversed the denial or taken corrective action effectively agreeing to the statements in my affidavits under ucc 1205 by failing to respond violations cited equal credit opportunity act 15 usc 1691 american expresss denial of my credit application appears to lack a lawful and objective basis suggesting discriminatory practices this violates ecoa which mandates equal and fair treatment in credit decisions truth in lending act 15 usc 1601 et seq tila requires clear disclosure of credit terms and finance charges american express did not provide essential disclosures including my right of rescission and failed to clarify how my social security number was used in the decision contravening tilas transparency requirements fair credit reporting act 15 usc 1681 et seq american express based its decision on my consumer report data without my consent and did not provide the legally required verification method despite knowing the consumer report information was false they used it to deny my application violating my rights under fcra failure to respond to notarized affidavits and invoice under ucc 1205 unrebutted affidavits stand as true by law by not responding to my affidavits and the 4900000 invoice within the required period american express tacitly agreed to the statements and charges within further demonstrating noncompliance with consumer protections use of unauthorized credit data and potential harassment american express sent duplicate denial notices which may constitute intimidation under 15 usc 1692 this unnecessary repetition without a lawful basis for denial violates protections against consumer harassment relief sought approval of the american express platinum card based on my documented affidavits and statutory rights i request immediate reconsideration and approval of my credit application compensation for damages i seek the invoiced amount of 4900000 in damages due to american expresss noncompliance with federal statutes and associated legal costs in addition to accountability for finance charges disclosed under tila but not honored full disclosure of credit denial reasons and verification method american express must provide a clear explanation of the factors and verification methods used in their decision and correct their reliance on false data in my consumer report conclusion and next steps i request that the cfpb investigate american express for noncompliance with ecoa tila fcra and related consumer protection laws as documented in my affidavits and invoiced demand if american express does not take corrective action within 10 business days i will pursue further legal remedies including arbitration and statutory claims under federal law attachment invoice for damages 4900000 thank you for your assistance in addressing these violations of consumer rights respectfully submitted xxxx xxxx xxxx

Consumer complaint narrative: when you submit a complaint through the cfpb you can choose to publish your description of what happened in the consumer complaint database on our website consumerfinancegov reading your firsthand account will help researchers consumers and others better understand the financial marketplace before publishing your description we will conduct a series of automated and manual reviews to remove personal information the following example highlights the kind of information that we plan to remove we took out a private education loan for our daughter xxxx while she was attending the xxxx university in xxxx ma this loan went into default after she transferred to a community college in xxxx ma our lender received notice that she was no longer a fulltime student in xx xx xxxx then our younger son xxxx became very sick and we could no longer make the monthly payments on our daughters loan we tried to set up a new payment plan to get us back on track but the servicer wont negotiate weve been paying what we can but we still havent reduced any of the principal on the loan we will monitor this scrubbing process so that all personal information is removed in accordance with our scrubbing standards but a risk remains that something will be missed and publicly released despite the scrubbing process someone may be able to identify you the scrubbing process takes some time and your description wont appear on the website right away the consumer complaint database includes information about the date product issue company and geographic information for complaints that are submitted through the cfpb but you are not required to publish your description of what happened whether you choose to publish your description will not affect how we handle your complaint if you change your mind you can withdraw your authorization at any time by calling the cfpb at xxxx xxxx if your description is already in the database it will be removed the next time the database is updated however we will not be able to remove it from any copies of the database that have been downloaded in the interim
